SENT.plain: This article reports a man who had herpes varicella zoster cervicalis with delayed stroke in the posterior circulation
Empiric treatment was acyclovir, methylprednisolone, and aspirin

Pontine infarction involving migration of the virus via cervicovascular innervation from C2 dorsal root ganglia to the vertebrobasilar circulation with attendant angiitis/angiopathy and thrombosis is proposed
